brief_description: Influenza primary infection study with murine subject
brief_title: Mouse Study of X31 Influenza Infection
description: Influenza primary infection study with murine subject
endpoints: Affymetrix gene expression assay on RNA extracted from lungs, lymph nodes, spleen and peripheral blood monocytes of female mice that did not have any infection or that received intranasal administration of influenza A virus either immediately before or 1 to 10 days before being euthanized for tissue collection.
hypothesis: Model gene regulatory networks in mice following A/HK-x31 influenza infection.
objectives: Design and conduct in vivo murine experiments to build, identify and experimentally validate the proposed immune response models by generating high frequency sampling and high dimensional datasets from mice with A/HK-x31 influenza virus infection.
official_title: Mouse Study of X31 Influenza Infection

personnel.organization: University of Rochester Center for Biodefense Immune Modeling

program.contract_name: University of Rochester Center for Biodefense Immune Modeling II
